TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DataChangedEventManager extends System.Windows.WeakEventManager

Docs.summary: Provides a implementation so that you can use the "weak event listener" pattern to attach listeners for the event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In order to be listeners in this pattern, your listener objects must implement <xref:System.Windows.IWeakEventListener>. You do not need to implement <xref:System.Windows.IWeakEventListener> on the class that is the source of the events.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void AddHandler (System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider source, EventHandler<EventArgs> handler);
.method public static hidebysig void AddHandler(class System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider source, class System.EventHandler`1<class System.EventArgs> handler) cil managed

Docs.param: The source object that the raises the event.
The delegate that handles the event.
Docs.summary: Adds the specified event handler, which is called when specified source raises the event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this method to specify the event handler you want to use to subscribe to the <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.DataChanged> event.. When you use this method, your listener object does not need to implement the <xref:System.Windows.IWeakEventListener> interface.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void AddListener (System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider source, System.Windows.IWeakEventListener listener);
.method public static hidebysig void AddListener(class System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider source, class System.Windows.IWeakEventListener listener) cil managed

Docs.param: The object to add as a listener.
Docs.summary: Adds the specified listener to the event of the specified source.

Docs.summary: Returns a new object to contain listeners to the event.
Docs.returns: A new object to contain listeners to the event.

Docs.summary: Begins listening for the event on the specified source.
